videos.title: Salty Lizard 100 // Gravel Race // Wendover, UT
videos.description:
Experience Keith's first-ever gravel race at the Salty Lizard 100 in Wendover, NV. This race was Keith's first attempt at riding a true century (100+ miles with over 4000ft of climbing!). Will he make it to the end? You'll have to watch to find out.

Filmed on October 8, 2022

#gravel #gravelracing #gravelbike #gravelbikes #gravelroad #gravelroads #saltylizard #wendover #bikeracing #bikerace #gopro #goprohero10 #goprohero10black #cycling #cyclinglife 

*Race Info*
Official Website: https://saltyandstupidcycling.com/salty-lizard-100/
Professional Photos:
 - https://www.instagram.com/samricephoto/
 - https://www.instagram.com/saltyandstupidcycling/
Strava Activity: https://www.strava.com/activities/7933182304

*Race Gear*
GoPro Hero 10 Black: https://amzn.to/3237We3
GoPro Hero 10 Super Suit: https://amzn.to/3fuRYwq
GoPro Hero 10 Enduro Batteries: https://amzn.to/3DbgBJY
Sunmon Camera Windscreens: https://amzn.to/3tvyHTI
Stuntman Chest Mount: https://amzn.to/2GZtDjA
GoPro Handlebar Mount: https://amzn.to/3NdM1UG
Handlebar Bag: https://amzn.to/3sATSSs
Toptube Bag: https://darkspeedworks.com/sp693.htm
Small USB Power Bank: https://amzn.to/3szdWEQ
PROBAR Meal Replacement Bars: https://amzn.to/3SFOTe1
Cliff Bloks: https://amzn.to/3DKr6pb

*Our Blog*
https://www.keithandlindsey.com

*Social Media*
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/keithandlindsey/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/keithandlindsey2017/
Twitter: https://twitter.com/keithandlindsey
Pinterest: https://www.pinterest.com/keithandlindsey0567/

*Chapters*
00:00 Intro & Overview
01:30 The Learning Curve
04:52 The Fun Part
09:56 The Difficult Part
12:16 Recovery Section
14:04 Long Slow Climb
14:49 THE BIG CLIMB!!!
18:58 Heading Towards Wendover
22:15 The Home Stretch

at this point I just tried to settle in

brain I guess I was getting a little

it was definitely hike a bike for me you

I've made it this far I'm gonna make it

I had another short little hike a bike

or not but it's super cool it's all
tagged up and kind of a unique thing to

desert once again and I kept thinking to
myself like man how much are we going to

further out into the desert but I just
kept pedaling
the desert Trails turned into this Old
Road that led us back into the town of
Wendover you can kind of see it off in
the distance here and this followed one
of the main highways and it felt good to
be on pavement again you know I love
riding on gravel and single track Trails
but every once in a while you just need
that smoothness to kind of let
everything settle down again and you
know take some pressure off your hands
and your in your butt so it's nice to
get that little break and finally here
we are I can see part of the town like I
I can mentally see the finish and I am
getting super excited at this point and
I started pushing harder and harder and
harder and I could feel those cramps
coming on in my calves but I tried to
stay hydrated and tried to eat a little
extra get a little sugar in me I was
just hoping I'd be able to push through
as I turned onto the section of Road
I could feel the end like I knew I was
getting close and I was getting so
excited I just kept thinking to myself
like holy cow
you rode a hundred mile race and you did
it successfully and you don't feel like
crap and you've kind of feel like you
can actually ride some more and it just
blew my mind like I thought for sure I
was going to get to this point and just
be crawling and dying and you know
saying why did I do this race and
instead like I got a smile on my face at
this point and I can see the end there's
the airport that we started at and I got

thrilled I cannot believe that I was
able to finally do this and do it
successfully and like I said you know
not feel like crap you know when you
really push your body like this and you
try something this hard you know
sometimes you don't make it but this
time I couldn't believe how well I did I
think all the planning and everything

think eight hours and seven minutes or

that's awesome
that was awesome

videos.title: Salty Lizard Gravel Race Highlights 2021
videos.description:
Wide-open vistas and long, endless dirt roads as they weave through the beautiful desert landscape.
This years race was one to remember as riders faced ferocious winds, loose gravel, sticky mud and much cooler temps than normal.

videos.title: Salty Lizard 100 Gravel Race  year four,  Oct  14, 2023
videos.description: I had the idea to start  this gravel race 5  years ago in my hometown of Wendover as it has amazing endless dirt roads. Together with Bobby and Becky we put on the race for the first time in 2020.  This is the 4th year for the Salty Lizard gravel race.   I no longer live in Wendover  but go out to visit my brother and always bring my gravel bike.  I love bringing folks out to ride with me as they are always amazed at all the seemingly endless gravel roads and wide open spaces.   I really love the Wendover desert.  Plus you can ride your gravel bike out there, typically, year round.  Thanks to  Ben who joined me on my ride.  We both live in Cache Valley and are members of the Logan Race Club.  We had a great road riding season doing many fast Tuesday Night rides and weekend  road centuries together.  This was fitting to do another century  with him this time on gravel.

videos.title: Wendover Salty Lizard 100K+ Gravel Grinder 4-13-19
videos.description: 1st Annual "Wendover Salty Lizard 100K+ Gravel Grinder"on Utah Nevada border.  A free event.  14 friends drove out (most from Cache Valley, 2 from Park City)  to spend a beautiful day riding in the desert. I set up a course in my old hometown of Wendover, with the first loop riding west in Nevada, including the Dead Cow Loop, (a cow had died on this loop years ago now  leaving just a scattering of bones).  This loop a bit more rocky and loose and up and down.  Then connecting into a pretty smooth dirt road, slightly downhill, I call the Pilot Peak Loop road as you ride toward 10,000 ft Pilot Peak that pierces the sky in the distance.  We will connecting back into the Dead Cow loop and back to our lunch spot at Leppy's trails   After lunch we rode East into Utah around the first portion of the Silver Island Mountains on the Silver Island Loop road.  The day of, my niece, Karen, who set up our lunch, suggested the lunch spot  be at Leppy's trail park for convenience.  That was a great suggestion but added another 10-miles to the ride, 72 miles if you rode the entire two loops with 5,500+ feet of climbing. Well worth it. Some rode enough to get  their 100K. The riders came from Northern Utah  the land of Ice and Snow our longest ride of the year.  As you can see a combination of mountain and gravel bikes were rode.  On the Dead Cow loop mountain bikes worked better but on the Pilot Peak and Silver Island loop gravel bike rolled great. We topped off the event with dinner at the Salt Flats Cafe, serving delicious Mexican food.  Mucho fun day.  Thanks to all the that participated.

videos.title: Salty Lizard 100  Race Oct. 3,  2020 - HD 1080p
videos.description: The first Salty Lizard 100-mile gravel race in Wendover, UT/NV put on by Salty and Stupid Cycling.  There were 3 categories, 100, 65, & 45 miles.  This video highlights the 100-mile racer &, Boyd Cycles sponsored Tinker Juarez. What an honor to have this cycling legend ride the Salty Lizard. Tinker will start 8 minutes behind the leaders and will make up that time in the first 35 miles and be on a solo chase of Tanner Visnick, a pro mountain bike racer. Tanner broke away at 15 miles on a climb and will solo in for an amazing victor in 5 hours and 39 minutes.   Unfortunately for Tinker, on a 36-mile loop around the Silver Island mountains, he took a wrong road and lost valuable time.  He will still finish 4th, what an amazing athlete as he is nearing 60 years old.  Mya Dixon, a 16-year racer on the Reno Devo team out of Reno, NV, will crush it beating many of the men to win the small field of women 100-mile racer, in 6 hrs 53 minutes.  Thanks to Reno Devo race team for bringing so many of their young talented cyclists.   John Croom, a national champion track cyclist, will have a mechanical and not finish, glad to have him there too. Jeff Sumsion and Benjamin Fichialos entered the Stupid Lizard category, riding the 220-mile Stupid Pony gravel race from Eagle Mtn, UT on the Pony Express trail, on Friday. It finished at the Historic Wendover airfield.  Those two then got up to race the Salty Lizard 100 Saturday morning.  Both finished the 320 mile 2-day event, outstanding.   Thanks to all participants that came and rode/raced the first Salty Lizard Gravel event.  Watch for the 2nd Salty Lizard video which will highlight the 65- & 45-mile participants.
